data.title: Worth a visit
data.text: Small town focus on the city of Mansfield, but very well done. Many exhibits about the history of the town and it's people. Two floors in an historic downtown buidling. My 8 year old grandson loved the upstairs which focuses on daily life in the early era of the town. Well worth spending an hour or so.

data.title: Surprisingly good!
data.text: The curators of this museum have done an excellent job showcasing the early history of the city, whose roots go back to the turn of the 20th century.  The lower level contains interesting exhibits and artifacts from the city's early history, and the upper level offers a glimpse into home living in the early 1900's, complete with what I believe are the actual furniture and appliances of the residence that originally occupied the second floor space.  I have lived in Mansfield for many years and I could kick myself for not having visited this place sooner.  It is worth the time for anyone interested in our city's heritage.

data.title: Love this place !
data.text:
The staff he is very knowledgeable and very friendly. You are made to feel very welcomed and they happily engage in any questions or interest.. They are so adoringly loving to the children as well. 
Greta place to bring your famoly.

data.title: Excellent local history museum!
data.text: I took my son here for an extra credit assignment and was very impressed. The museum is laid out very well over two floors in downtown mansfield on Main Street. There are a ton of local artifacts of Mansfield history dating back to 1856. Plan to spend at least an hour here because even though it's small there's a lot to see and read.

data.title: Little known Gem on Main Street, Mansfield.
data.text:
This deceivingly small  museum actually has much to see and is very informative. Wonderful old photographs and artifacts from over 125 years ago when Mansfield was founded. 
 The staff is great and knowledgeable. A worthwhile visit with younger people especially to help History come Alive!

data.title: See when Mansfield was born
data.text:
Plan to stay awhile if you enjoy visiting Historical Museums.
the Mansfield Historical Museum is Loaded with artifacts from the early days of this town.   Be sure to go to the 2nd floor.

data.title: Nice
data.text: We were killing time one day and decided to go in, this is a nice little museum, we enjoyed walking through it and the staff was friendly and helpful, throughout our visit.

data.title: Mansfield Texas, Minutes to Everything, Second to None
data.text: A beautifully appointed little museum in the old down-town section of Mansfield. There is a full time employee there to talk to you about Mansfield's history, but there are also well planned storyboards which make it easy to do your own tour of the museum. There are many artifacts from Mansfield's past and it is obvious that the citizens are justly proud of their past as the city helps fund the museum.  It is well worth the short trip from Fort Worth and just a real pity that this little gem of a downtown has been practically stranded because of the major shopping area a couple of miles away. This area could do with the Grapevine touch - it has so much going for it. It's easy to see why Mansfield is listed as one of the best places to live in Texas.

data.title: Big Little Museum
data.text: I love museum and even though this is very small...it has some very interesting pieces depicting the history of Mansfield.  The gentleman in charge of the museum the day that I visited was very informative and helpful.  Everyone interested in the city of Mansfield should visit this little jewel of a museum.

data.title: Nice place
data.text: Visited with school group.  They have done a great job of compiling a historical snapshot of the town.

data.title: Great place to learn city history
data.text: We found this museum by accident one day and were surprised with the amount of history that they had about our city and how well organized it was.

data.title: Surprising how well organized for a small town museum!
data.text: A well maintained historical mission. The museum's displays are presented in such a manner to draw ones attention.  The attention to detail is seen throughout the museum. Definitely a must for Mansfield residents.

data.title: A Small Town With a Great History
data.text: This small but well-organized museum tells the history of not only Mansfield, Tx, but also of the surrounding area.  There are many interesting artifacts. Verne, the volunteer on duty, was open, interesting, and even helped us choose our dining place.

data.title: A must for all Local Residents
data.text: A little gem hidden away in downtown.  My step-daughter and I visited on a rainy afternoon and she just loved looking at all the memorabilia as much as I did.  We learned so much about our local history and really enjoyed the time spent there.  This is a small museum but packed with interesting pieces that all have a story.  Well worth an hour or two of your time.  It may even inspire you to get more involved in this great little city.

data.title: good local historical museum
data.text: If you visit the Big Cities of Dallas and Fort Worth, with their somewhat glorified cowboy-centered tourist spots, you might find it interesting to include a local historical museum such as the one in Mansfield, south of Arlington, to see how Texas towns really developed.  This small museum, located in a historic building on the main street, has two floors of well-organized exhibits that relate the town's history.  A flyer available at the museum provides a historical overview of the town and a map of historical residences.   The volunteer staff we met were friendly and informative. There is even a vintage elevator that makes the second floor accessible to people who have difficulty negotiating stairs.
